template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2(3.5) or later version: 0.7

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME} might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.{#ENT_NAME} serial number has changed. Ack to close

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPINDEX}] CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html The cpmCPUTotal5minRev MIB object provides a more accurate view of the performance of the router over time than the MIB objects cpmCPUTotal1minRev and cpmCPUTotal5secRev . These MIB objects are not accurate because they look at CPU at one minute and five second intervals, respectively. These MIBs enable you to monitor the trends and plan the capacity of your network. The recommended baseline rising threshold for cpmCPUTotal5minRev is 90 percent. Depending on the platform, some routers that run at 90 percent, for example, 2500s, can exhibit performance degradation versus a high-end router, for example, the 7500 series, which can operate fine.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:system.cpu.util[cpmCPUTotal5minRev.{#SNMPINDEX}.].avg(5m)}>{$CPU_UTIL_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPINDEX}] High CPU utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/12_2/configfun/configuration/guide/ffun_c/fcf009.html

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Available memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed andciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:vm.memory.pused[vm.memory.pused.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$MEMORY_UTIL_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] High memory utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoEnvMonTemperatureTable (ciscoEnvMonTemperatureDescr), a table of ambient temperature status maintained by the environmental monitor.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Temperature
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current measurement of the testpoint being instrumented.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Temperature status
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current state of the testpoint being instrumented.

trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.temp.value[ciscoEnvMonTemperatureValue.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}-5
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})({ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE} temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})({ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.temp.value[ciscoEnvMonTemperatureValue.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}-5

trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.temp.value[ciscoEnvMonTemperatureValue.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}-5
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})({ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.temp.value[ciscoEnvMonTemperatureValue.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}<{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.temp.value[ciscoEnvMonTemperatureValue.{#SNMPINDEX}].min(5m)}>{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}+5
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}={$PSU_CRIT_STATUS}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SENSOR_INFO}] Power supply is in critical state (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Please check the power supply unit for errors

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of fan status maintained by the environmental monitor.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}={$FAN_CRIT_STATUS}
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO} fan is in critical state (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Please check the fan unit

template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0(3)T and prior to 12.2(3.5) version: 0.7

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME} might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.{#ENT_NAME} serial number has changed. Ack to close

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}={$PSU_CRIT_STATUS}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SENSOR_INFO}] Power supply is in critical state (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Please check the power supply unit for errors

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of fan status maintained by the environmental monitor.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}={$FAN_CRIT_STATUS}
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO} fan is in critical state (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Please check the fan unit

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period. This object deprecates the avgBusy5 object from the OLD-CISCO-SYSTEM-MIB. This object is deprecated by cpmCPUTotal5minRev which has the changed range of value (0..100)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:system.cpu.util[cpmCPUTotal5min.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$CPU_UTIL_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] High CPU utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Available memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device. Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed andciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memoryin the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:vm.memory.pused[vm.memory.pused.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$MEMORY_UTIL_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] High memory utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0(3)T version: 0.7

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html 5 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME} might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.{#ENT_NAME} serial number has changed. Ack to close

discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(0)}={$PSU_CRIT_STATUS}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SENSOR_INFO}] Power supply is in critical state (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Please check the power supply unit for errors

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Available memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device. Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed and ciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:vm.memory.pused[vm.memory.pused.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}>{$MEMORY_UTIL_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] High memory utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

trigger.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

trigger.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

trigger.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:system.cpu.util[avgBusy5].avg(5m)}>{$CPU_UTIL_MAX}
trigger.name: High CPU utilization (now: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1})

trigger.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device might have been replaced (new serial number:{ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.Device serial number has changed. Ack to close
